definition[0]: to enter a place, especially when this is difficult
example[0]: The door was locked and we couldn’t get into the house.
example[1]: What time do we get into New York?
definition[2]: to be elected to a Parliament
example[2]: He first got into Parliament in 1982.
definition[3]: to be allowed to be a student at a university, college etc
definition[4]: to be made a member of a team
example[4]: Do you think you might get into the Olympic team this year?
definition[5]: to start doing or feeling something, or being in a particular situation
example[5]: He’s started getting into trouble at school.
example[6]: My parents were always terrified of getting into debt.
example[7]: She got into the habit of going for long walks by herself.
example[8]: He got into a terrible temper and started throwing things around.
definition[6]: to begin to be involved in doing something
example[9]: How did you first get into script writing?
example[10]: She was starting to get into politics.
definition[7]: to begin to enjoy something or be interested in it
example[11]: I first got into jazz when I was at college.
definition[8]: to put on a piece of clothing, especially when this is difficult because the piece of clothing is too small for you
example[12]: I don’t know how she managed to get into those trousers.
definition[9]: used to express surprise that someone is behaving very differently from the way they usually behave
example[13]: I don’t know what’s got into Sally recently.
definition[10]: to start working or trading in a particular product or service
example[14]: Many young people want to get into advertising or public relations.
